pr_title: Configurable MIME type for mustache template encoding on set processor

timeline.message: configurable MIME type for mustache template encoding
add unit test and DRY up constants

timeline.bodyText:
are we sure we want mime_type as a name here? I thought mime was replace with media_type
but wouldn't content_type  be more consistent with what we have in mustache templating engine?
timeline.author: pgomulka

replies.bodyText: or we could consider to rename the content_type to media_type (in mustache template engine)?
replies.author: pgomulka

replies.bodyText: I'm happy to rename to whatever is most appropriate. I went with mime_type because that is what was used in CustomMustacheFactory but I would agree that media_type or possibly content_type would be better.
replies.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText: +1 to follow up with a change to media_type to be more correct.
replies.author: jakelandis

timeline.bodyText:
do we want the se hardcoded? What if someone specifies application/json; charset=utf-8 ?
Would it be of any help if this bit was unified with what CustomMustacheFactory defines? I made an attempt here https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/66857/files#diff-207cacc1e4a5b24109a693c0b63dd762156452bb5984b5ce04499b28e6c191e8R28
timeline.author: pgomulka

replies.bodyText: I agree that unifying this set of options would be good. I can do that after you merge that PR. I don't believe that we want to allow the specification of a particular character set for the use case of the ingest processor, though.
replies.author: danhermann

replies.bodyText: Now that #66857 has been closed in favor of #67677, I believe the only improvement that can be made here is changing content_type to media_type. I'll go ahead and open a PR for that.
replies.author: danhermann
